contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Yoichi |JapaneseName= 余市町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Yoichi in Shiribeshi Subprefecture.gif |Region= [[Hokkaidō]] |Prefecture= [[Hokkaidō]] ([[Shiribeshi Subprefecture|Shiribeshi]]) |District= [[Yoichi District, Hokkaidō|Yoichi]] |Area_km2= 140.60 |PopDate= 2008 |Population= 21,908 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 43 |LatitudeMinutes= 12 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 140 |LongtitudeMinutes= 47 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= {{Official website|http://www.town.yoichi.hokkaido.jp/}} }} {{nihongo|'''Yoichi'''|余市町|Yoichi-chō}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in the [[Yoichi District, Hokkaidō|Yoichi District]], [[Shiribeshi Subprefecture|Shiribeshi]], [[Hokkaidō]], [[Japan]]. ==Demographics== As of 2008, the [[population]] of Yoichi is estimated to be 21,908 with a [[population density|density]] of 160 persons per km². The total area of Yoichi is 140.60 km². The climate is mild (8.2°C average), with temperatures ranging from -6°C to 26°C.<ref>Web Japan (http://web-japan.org)</ref> ==Industry== Yoichi is home of the [[Nikka Whisky Distilling]]. Yoichi is famous for fruit, particularly apples, and wine, and Yoichi apple juice is also famous throughout Japan. Yoichi is also the home of Kosugi Motors, one of the oldest car dealerships in Shiribeshi region of Hokkaidō.<ref>[http://www.kosugimotors.com Yoichi Dealer]</ref> ==Culture and tourism== A coastal town, with a particularly nice beach, Yoichi is popular with surfers for a large part of the year, and also a popular tourist destination for Japanese holiday makers during the hotter months of July and August. Yoichi is the birthplace of the "Soran" folk song, known throughout Japan, and recently associated with the Hokkaidan [[Yosakoi]] dance.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} The Yoichi Soran festival, featuring [[dancing]], [[firework]]s and delicious food and drink, is held every year in the first weekend of July, a few weeks after the Yoichi shrine festival. The [[cave paintings]] at [[Fugoppe Cave]] in Yoichi are the first known signs of [[prehistoric life]] on Hokkaidō. Yoichi is easily accessible by [[bus]] and [[train]], which run approximately hourly to and from [[Otaru]], [[Sapporo]], and [[Kutchan]], a town 45 minutes south of Yoichi where world class [[skiing]] and [[snowboarding]] may be enjoyed. ==Twin Town== *{{flagicon|Scotland}} {{flagicon|UK}} [[Bishopbriggs]], [[East Dunbartonshire]], [[Scotland]] ==Notable people== Yoichi is the birthplace of [[Mamoru Mohri|Mamoru "Mark" Mohri]], the first Japanese [[astronaut]]; he attended elementary and junior high schools here. The [[Yoichi Space Museum]], also called the [[Space Apple]]), was dedicated in his honor when it opened in 1998. Other Yoichi luminaries include ski-jump gold medallists in [[Winter Olympic Games]]. ==References== <references/> ==External links== {{Commons category|Yoichi, Hokkaido|Yoichi, Hokkaidō}} *[http://www.town.yoichi.hokkaido.jp/ Official website] {{ja icon}} *[http://www.yoichi-kankoukyoukai.net/english/midokoro.html Recommendations of the Yoichi sightseeing association] {{en icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yoichi, Hokkaido}} [[Category:Towns in Hokkaido]] {{Hokkaido-geo-stub}}
